title: The Power of Framing in Business
description: A quick win: understand The Power of Framing in Business.

hook.text: 'We're cutting costs' vs. 'We're investing in efficiency.' Same action, different frame, different reaction.

buildup.text: Framing is how you present information to influence how it's received. The facts don't change â€” the lens does.

discovery.text: Tversky and Kahneman's framing experiments showed identical choices get opposite responses depending on framing.

twist.text: Loss framing ('We'll lose market share') motivates faster than gain framing ('We'll gain market share').

climax.text: Match your frame to your audience: executives respond to loss/risk, teams respond to vision/opportunity.

punchline.text: The frame changes the picture without changing the facts.

quiz.question: What does framing do in business communication?
options: Changes how information is received without changing the facts
